metadata.title: CVE-2016-3183 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The sycc422_t_rgb function in common/color.c in OpenJPEG before 2.1.1allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read)via a crafted jpeg2000 file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3183` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.1.1-1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.1.1-1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.1.1-1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.1.1-1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.1.1-1
libopenjpip-server - 2.1.1-1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.1.1-1
libopenjpip7 - 2.1.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-1').
